title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1402.2 - Agency obligations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1402.2 - Agency obligations

State Regulations
(a) Any
agency which seeks to establish a system of records subsequent to September 1, 1984 shall file with the committee a privacy impact statement. (b) Any agency which seeks to modify a system
of records in a way that would render inaccurate a privacy impact statement
previously submitted to the committee, or a notice filed pursuant to chapter
677 of the Laws of 1980, shall file with the committee a supplemental statement
to conform the privacy impact statement or notice to the proposed
modification. (c) Unless the date by
which a proposed system of records or modification of an existing system of
records is required by law to be instituted is less than 30 business days from
the date of the filing of the privacy impact statement, no such system or
modification shall be instituted until the completion of the procedures set
forth in subdivision 3 of section
93
of the

Public Officers Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1402.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
